Name: calibratedAmenities
Description: Amenity index: follows calibration from Pfeiffer et al. (appendix C4)

Name: calibratedHousing_b
Description: Housing production function parameter, as calibrated in Pfeiffer et al. (table C7): capital elasticity

Name: calibratedHousing_kappa
Description: Housing production function parameter, as calibrated in Pfeiffer et al. (table C7): scale parameter

Name: calibratedUtility_beta
Description: Utility function parameter, as calibrated in Pfeiffer et al. (table C7): surplus housing elasticity

Name: calibratedUtility_q0
Description: Utility function parameter, as calibrated in Pfeiffer et al. (table C7): basic need in housing

Name: data
Description: Matlab structure containing various household data, essentially at the SP level

Name: incomeCentersKeep
Description: Calibrated incomes per income group and job center (see Pfeiffer et al., appendix C3)

Name: lambdaKeep
Description: Gravity parameter of the minimum Gumbel distribution (see Pfeiffer et al.), as calibrated in appendix C3

Name: Transport_times_GRID
Description: Transport times for a round trip with several transportation modes between all grid cells

Name: Transport_times_SP
Description: Transport times for a round trip with several transportation modes between all census blocks

Name: TAZ_ampp_prod_attr_2013_2032
Description: Geographic data at the transport zone level, used to map employment data

Name: grid_reference_500
Description: Geographic data at the grid cell level, used to map model outputs

Name: Scenario_inc_distrib_1
Description: Lower inequality: income of groups 3 and 4 decrease by 10% relatively to groups 1 and 2

Name: Scenario_inc_distrib_2
Description: Reference scenario: income distribution remains the same as in 2011

Name: Scenario_inc_distrib_3
Description: Higher inequality: income of groups 3 and 4 increase by 10% relatively to group 1 and 2

Name: Scenario_inflation_1
Description: Reference scenario

Name: Scenario_interest_rate_1
Description: Reference scenario: interest rate constant after 2014

Name: Scenario_pop_1
Description: Low growth: population in 2040 is 10% lower than reference scenario

Name: Scenario_pop_2
Description: Reference scenario

Name: Scenario_pop_3
Description: High growth: population in 2040 is 10% higher than reference scenario

Name: Scenario_pop_20201209
Description: High growth: population in 2040 is 10% higher than reference scenario (alternative specification)

Name: Scenario_price_fuel_1
Description: Reference scenario: price of fuel increases with inflation

Name: grid_NEDUM_Cape_Town_500
Description: Standard geographic data on CoCT's grid used in model

Name: grid_new_RDP_projects
Description: Scenarios for formal subsidized housing construction: used to define land availability

Name: grid_SAL_intersect
Description: Correspondance table between Small Areas and grid cells

Name: grid_SP_intersect
Description: Correspondance table between Small Places and grid cells

Name: grid_amenities
Description: Exogenous amenities at grid cell level

Name: SP_amenities
Description: Exogenous amenities at SP level

Name: Income_distribution_2011
Description: Income distribution inputs into the model

Name: TAZ_amp_2013_proj_centro2
Description: Employment data at the Transport Zone level, used in calibration
Flood depth hazard and share of flood-prone areas for fluvial undefended (FU), fluvial defended (FD), pluvial (P), and coastal (C) floods

Name: inf_dwellings_2020
Description: Number of informal dwellings in 2020, used to define land availability

Name: informal_settlements_risk
Description: Areas at risk of new informal settlements (9 scenarios)

Name: polygon_medium_timing
Description: Semi-agricultural land (Philippi neighbourhood), whose squatting risk can be changed to model push-back from farmers

Name: [dim]_incomeNetOfCommuting_[year]
Description: Income net of commuting costs for each income bracket in model, as calibrated in Pfeiffer et al. (see part 3.1 or appendix C3), simulated over 30 years

Name: housing_types_grid_sal
Description: Population density per housing type, used for validation

Name: housing_types_sal_analysis
Description: SAL data that shows the breakdown across multiple housing categories and from which we recover aggregate population values

Name: HH-budget-floods
Description: Breakdown of representative household budget in main districts, from which we deduce the fraction of composite good at risk of destruction from floods

Name: Transport-costs
Description: Regression data that define fixed and variable components of various public transportation modes (based on Roux, 2013)
